 Coronavirus (COVID-19) – Information and Resources 
 The University of California, Riverside campus is closed. Winter and Spring 2021 quarters and summer sessions will continue with Remote Learning. All on-campus events are cancelled until further notice. All in-person, non-essential gatherings on campus are suspended until further notice. For UCR campus information and updates, please visit the  UCR Coronavirus (COVID-19) webpage . 
 On this page, Human Resources is providing information and resources for UCR staff to navigate through the campus impact from COVID-19.

 LinkedIn Learning 
Remote Work Resources 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 LinkedIn Learning Remote Work Resources 
 Remote work is a new and uncharted territory for many of us.  Yet, practically overnight, it is our new reality.  Since it is now a requirement for UC Riverside staff, we want to give you the tools you need to remain productive while we navigate through this significant change in how we work. 
 LinkedIn Learning has 16 online resources that will provide valuable insight into this new normal.  Whether you are an employee who needs to learn how to use new tools, or a supervisor who wants to keep their staff engaged and productive, LinkedIn Learning has courses to help. To see a listing of suggested learning, please review the  Suggested LinkedIn Learning Guide . 
 For more information, please visit  LinkedIn Learning – Work From Home Resources .  
 
   
 
 
 
 
 
 
 UCPath 
COVID-19 FAQs 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 To reassure all, the UCPath Center has notified all campuses that the UCPath Payroll will continue amidst COVID-19 mitigation measures. Payroll processing is a critical function and will continue during the campus closure. We are also working locally as a campus to ensure that we have the structure in place to support on-time payroll processing and timely responses/updates. To view the UCPath COVID-19 FAQs, please visit the  UCPath Campus Support Center website . 
   
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 UC Benefits Plans 
FSA Program 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The UCR Health & Welfare Benefits team have been working closely with UCPath, the Office of General Counsel, the plan administrators and carriers, and their consulting partners to understand the impact of the new rule and guidance and develop implementation plans.  The  Important Changes to UC Benefits / FSA Programs webpage   details what benefits plan changes has been determined to date. Please note that this is a constantly evolving landscape, and we will continue to share information as it becomes available.

 Supervisor 
Guidance 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The  Supervisor Guidance – New Hires During Campus Closure webpage  provides guidance to assist campus units in navigating staff and undergraduate student hiring, onboarding, off-boarding and leave actions during the period of the closure, and as employees begin to use Paid Administrative Leave due to the COVID-19 crisis. 
   
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Return To 
Campus 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Working remotely is the default mode of operation and all are requested to continue to do so until further notice. All returns to the workplace must be pre-approved. If you have any questions or concerns about this, please speak with your supervisor. Additionally, with the understanding that spikes or outbreaks of new COVID-19 infections could occur, all operations will be ready to retreat to conservative phases if safety concerns arise. The  Return to Campus Protocols webpage  provides guidance which applies to all employees who perform duties on campus or UC leased or affiliated properties, unless the facility has expressly provided different instructions.
